{
  "article_text": [
    "ideals generated by minors have been studied extensively .",
    "they are a central topic in commutative algebra , where they have been investigated mainly using grbner bases and combinatorial techniques ( see among others  @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , @xcite ) .",
    "they are also relevant in algebraic geometry , since many classical varieties such as the veronese and the segre variety are cut out by minors .",
    "degeneracy loci of morphisms between direct sums of line bundles over projective space have a determinantal description , as do the schubert varieties .    in this paper , we study ideals of minors in a symmetric matrix from the point of view of liaison theory . in particular , we consider ideals generated by minors of mixed size which are contained in a symmetric ladder .",
    "cogenerated ideals in a ladder of a symmetric matrix belong to the family that we study .",
    "the family of cogenerated ideals is a natural one to study from the combinatorial point of view ( see  @xcite or  @xcite ) .",
    "however , from the point of view of liaison theory it is more natural to study a larger class of ideals , as they naturally arise during the linkage process .",
    "we call them symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals .",
    "in section  1 we set the notation and define symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals ( definition  [ ldi ] ) .",
    "in example  [ excog ] ( 3 ) we discuss why cogenerated ladder determinantal ideals of a symmetric matrix are a special case of symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals . in proposition  [ primecm ] we show that symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals are prime and cohen - macaulay . in proposition  [ ht ]",
    "we express their height as the cardinality of a suitable subladder .    in section  2",
    "we review the notion of g - biliaison , stating the definition and main result in the algebraic language ( see definition  [ bilid ] and theorem  [ bil ] ) . in theorem  [ biliaison ]",
    "we prove that symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals can be obtained from ideals of linear forms by ascending g - biliaison . in particular , they are glicci ( corollary  [ glicci ] ) .",
    "let @xmath0 be an algebraically closed field .",
    "let @xmath1 be an @xmath2 symmetric matrix of indeterminates .",
    "in other words , the entries @xmath3 with @xmath4 are distinct indeterminates , and @xmath5 for @xmath6 .",
    "let @xmath7=k[x_{ij}\\mid 1\\leq i\\leq j\\leq n]$ ] be the polynomial ring associated to the matrix @xmath8 . in this paper , we study ideals generated by the minors contained in a ladder of a generic symmetric matrix from the point of view of liaison theory . throughout the paper , we only consider symmetric ladders .",
    "this can be done without loss of generality , since the ideal generated by the minors in a ladder of a symmetric matrix coincides with the ideal generated by the minors in the smallest symmetric ladder containing it .",
    "[ ladd ] a * ladder * @xmath9 of @xmath8 is a subset of the set @xmath10 with the following properties :    1 .   if @xmath11 then @xmath12 ( i.e. @xmath9 is symmetric ) , and 2 .   if @xmath13 and @xmath14 , then @xmath15 .",
    "we do not make any connectedness assumption on the ladder @xmath9 .",
    "for ease of notation , we also do not assume that @xmath8 is the smallest symmetric matrix containing @xmath9 .",
    "let @xmath16 since @xmath9 is symmetric , @xmath17 determines @xmath9 and vice versa .",
    "we will abuse terminology and call @xmath17 a ladder .",
    "observe that @xmath17 can be written as @xmath18 @xmath19 for some integers @xmath20 , @xmath21 , @xmath22 , and @xmath23 , with @xmath24 for @xmath25 and @xmath26 for @xmath27 .",
    "the points @xmath28 are the * lower outside corners * of the ladder , @xmath29 are the * lower inside corners * , @xmath30 the * upper outside corners * , and @xmath31 the * upper inside corners*. if @xmath32 , then @xmath33 is a lower outside corner and we set @xmath34 . similarly , if @xmath35 then @xmath36 is an upper outside corner , and we set @xmath37 .",
    "see also figure  [ fig1 ] .",
    "a ladder has at least one upper and one lower outside corner .",
    "moreover , @xmath38 is both an upper and a lower inside corner .",
    "the * upper border * of @xmath17 consists of the elements @xmath39 of @xmath17 such that either @xmath40 and @xmath41 , or @xmath42 and @xmath43 for some @xmath44 . see figure  [ fig2 ] .",
    "all the corners belong to @xmath17 .",
    "in fact , the ladder @xmath17 corresponds to its set of lower and upper outside ( or equivalently lower and upper inside ) corners .",
    "the upper corners of a ladder belong to its upper border .",
    "given a ladder @xmath9 we set @xmath45 , and denote by @xmath46 $ ] the polynomial ring @xmath47 $ ] .",
    "for @xmath48 a positive integer , and @xmath49 , @xmath50 integers , we denote by @xmath51 $ ] the @xmath48-minor @xmath52 .",
    "we let @xmath53 denote the ideal generated by the set of the @xmath48-minors of @xmath8 which involve only indeterminates of @xmath54 .",
    "in particular @xmath55 is the ideal of @xmath7 $ ] generated by the minors of @xmath8 of size @xmath56 .    in this article",
    ", we study the g - biliaison class of a large family of ideals generated by minors in a ladder of a symmetric matrix .",

    "this was observed by conca in  @xcite .    in this section",
    "we establish some properties of symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals .",
    "it is known ( @xcite ) that cogenerated ideals are prime and cohen - macaulay . in the sequel",
    "we show that the result of conca easily extends to symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals .",
    "we exploit a well known localization technique ( see  @xcite , lemma  7.3.3 ) .",
    "the same argument was used to prove lemma  1.19 in  @xcite .",
    "for completeness , we state it for the case of a ladder of a symmetric matrix and we outline the proof .",
    "we use the notation of definitions  [ ladd ] and  [ ldi ] . from remark",
    "[ conv ] ( 4 ) we know that we can always find @xmath98 such that @xmath107 , @xmath99 and @xmath100 , unless @xmath136 .    [ local ] let @xmath9 be a ladder of a symmetric matrix @xmath8 of indeterminates .",
    "@xmath9 has a set of distinguished points @xmath137 and @xmath138 .",
    "let @xmath53 be the corresponding symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideal .",
    "let @xmath98 such that @xmath107 , @xmath99 and @xmath100 .",

    "let @xmath142 be the distinguished points of @xmath140 .",

    "let @xmath145[x_{v_k , w_k}^{-1}]\\ ] ] and @xmath146[x_{v_{k-1}+1,w_k},\\ldots , x_{v_k-1,w_k } , x_{v_k , w_k}^{\\pm 1},x_{v_k , w_k-1},\\ldots , x_{v_k , w_{k+1}+1}].\\ ] ] define a @xmath0-algebra homomorphism @xmath147 the inverse of @xmath148 is @xmath149 it is easy to check that @xmath148 and @xmath150 are inverse to each other .",
    "since @xmath151 we have @xmath152    using lemma  [ local ] we can establish some properties of symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals .",
    "[ primecm ] symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals are prime and cohen - macaulay .",
    "let @xmath53 be the symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideal associated to the ladder @xmath9 with distinguished points @xmath70 and @xmath65 .",
    "let @xmath153 . if @xmath154 then @xmath53 is generated by indeterminates , hence it is prime and cohen - macaulay .",
    "therefore assume that @xmath155 and let @xmath156 be the ladder with the same lower outside corners as @xmath9 , and upper outside corners @xmath157 for @xmath124 .",
    "notice that the corners are distinct , and the inequalities of definition  [ ladd ] are satisfied by remark  [ conv ] ( 3 ) .",
    "in other words , for each @xmath158 we have @xmath159 let @xmath160 and let @xmath161 . denote by @xmath162 the ideal generated by the minors of size @xmath163 which involve only indeterminates in @xmath164 . by lemma",
    "[ local ] there exists a subset @xmath165 of @xmath135 such that @xmath166/i_{t_{\\mbox{\\tiny max}}}({\\widehat    l})[z_1^{-1},\\ldots , z_m^{-1}]\\cong   k[l]/i_t(l)[m][z_1^{-1},\\ldots , z_m^{-1}].\\ ] ] the ring @xmath167/i_{t_{\\mbox{\\tiny max}}}({\\widehat l})$ ] is a cohen - macaulay domain by theorem  1.13 in  @xcite .",
    "therefore @xmath46/i_t(l)[m][z_1^{-1},\\ldots , z_m^{-1}]$ ] is a cohen - macaulay domain .",
    "since @xmath135 is a set of indeterminates over the ring @xmath46/i_t(l)$ ] and @xmath168 , then @xmath46/i_t(l)[m]$ ] is a cohen - macaulay domain .",
    "hence @xmath53 is prime and cohen - macaulay .",
    "a standard argument allows us to compute the height of symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals .",
    "these heights have been computed by conca in  @xcite for the family of cogenerated ideals .",
    "the arguments in  @xcite are of a more combinatorial nature , and the height is expressed as a sum of lengths of maximal chains in some subladders .",
    "our formula for the height is very simple .",
    "the proof is independent of the results of conca , and it essentially follows from lemma  [ local ] .",
    "we use the same notation as in definitions  [ ladd ] and  [ ldi ] , and lemma  [ local ] .",
    "an example is given in figure  [ fig4 ] .",
    "[ ht ] let @xmath9 be a ladder with distinguished points @xmath70 and let @xmath169 @xmath170 let @xmath171 then @xmath172 is a symmetric ladder and @xmath173    observe that by remark  [ conv ] ( 3 ) @xmath174 therefore @xmath172 is a ladder with upper outside corners @xmath175 and the same lower outside corners as @xmath9 .",
    "let @xmath176 .",
    "we argue by induction on @xmath177 . if @xmath178 , then @xmath179 , and @xmath180 .",
    "hence @xmath181 assume now that the thesis holds for @xmath182 and prove it for @xmath183 .",
    "since @xmath184 , by remark  [ conv ] ( 4 ) there exists @xmath98 such that @xmath107 , @xmath99 and @xmath100 . by lemma",
    "[ local ] we have an isomorphism between @xmath46/i_t(l)[x_{v_k , w_k}^{-1}]$ ] and @xmath143/i_{t'}(l')[x_{v_{k-1},w_k},\\ldots , x_{v_k-1,w_k},x_{v_k , w_k}^{\\pm 1},x_{v_k , w_k-1},\\ldots , x_{v_k , w_{k+1}+1}].\\ ] ] since @xmath185 does not divide zero modulo @xmath144 and @xmath186 , we have @xmath187 the thesis follows by the induction hypothesis , observing that the same ladder @xmath172 computes the height of both @xmath144 and @xmath186 .",
    "in this section we study symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals from the point of view of liaison theory . we prove that they belong to the g - biliaison class of a complete intersection . in particular , they are glicci .",
    "this is yet another family of ideals of minors for which one can perform a descending g - biliaison to an ideal in the same family , in such a way that one eventually reaches an ideal generated by linear forms .",
    "other families of ideals that were treated with an analogous technique are ideals generated by maximal minors of a matrix with polynomial entries @xcite , minors of a symmetric matrix with polynomial entries @xcite , minors of a matrix with polynomial entries @xcite , minors of mixed size in a ladder of a generic matrix @xcite , and pfaffians of mixed size in a ladder of a generic skew - symmetric matrix @xcite .    in @xcite , @xcite ,",
    "@xcite hartshorne developed the theory of generalized divisors , which is a useful language for the study of gorenstein liaison via the study of g - biliaison classes . in  @xcite it was shown that even ci - liaison and ci - biliaison generate the same equivalence classes . in  @xcite",
    "kleppe , migliore , mir - roig , nagel and peterson proved that a g - biliaison on an arithmetically cohen - macaulay , @xmath188 scheme can be realized via two g - links .",
    "the result was generalized in  @xcite by hartshorne to g - biliaison on an arithmetically cohen - macaulay , @xmath189 scheme .",
    "in proposition  [ primecm ] we saw that symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals are prime , hence they define reduced and irreducible , projective algebraic varieties . since we wish to work in the algebraic setting , we state the definition of g - biliaison and the main theorem connecting g - biliaison and g - liaison in the language of ideals .",
    "[ gc ] let @xmath190 $ ] and let @xmath191 be a homogeneous , saturated ideal .",
    "we say that @xmath192 is * gorenstein in codimension @xmath193 c * if the localization @xmath194 is a gorenstein ring for any prime ideal @xmath195 of @xmath196 of height smaller than or equal to @xmath197 .",
    "we often say that @xmath192 is @xmath198 .",
    "we call * generically gorenstein * , or @xmath189 , an ideal @xmath192 which is gorenstein in codimension 0 .",
    "( @xcite , sect .",
    "3)[bilid ] let @xmath199 $ ] and let @xmath200 and @xmath201 be homogeneous ideals in @xmath202 of pure height @xmath197 .",
    "we say that @xmath200 is obtained by an * elementary g - biliaison * of height @xmath203 from @xmath201 if there exists a cohen - macaulay , generically gorenstein ideal @xmath192 in @xmath202 of height @xmath204 such that @xmath205 and @xmath206(-h)$ ] as @xmath196-modules .",
    "if @xmath207 we speak about * ascending * elementary g - biliaison .",
    "[ bil][kleppe , migliore , mir - roig , nagel , peterson  @xcite ; hartshorne  @xcite ] let @xmath200 be obtained by an elementary g - biliaison from @xmath201 .",
    "then @xmath201 is g - linked to @xmath200 in two steps .",
    "we now show that symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals belong to the g - biliaison class of a complete intersection .",
    "the idea of the proof is as follows : starting from a symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideal @xmath208 , we construct two symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals @xmath209 and @xmath192 such that @xmath192 is contained in @xmath210 and @xmath211 .",
    "we show that @xmath208 can be obtained from @xmath209 by an elementary g - biliaison of height 1 on @xmath192 .",

    "we claim that @xmath227 it is clear that @xmath228 .",
    "the inclusion @xmath229 follows from @xmath230      we claim that @xmath53 is obtained from @xmath144 by an elementary g - biliaison of height @xmath233 on @xmath226 .",
    "this is equivalent to showing that @xmath234(-1)\\ ] ] as @xmath235-modules .",
    "denote by @xmath236 $ ] the @xmath56-minor of @xmath8 which involves rows @xmath237 and columns @xmath238 .",
    "we claim that multiplication by @xmath239}{[v_k - t_k+1,\\ldots , v_k-1,v_k ;    w_k - t_k+1,\\ldots , w_k-1,w_k]}\\ ] ] yields an isomorphism between @xmath240 and @xmath241(-1)$ ] .",
    "notice in fact that the ideal @xmath240 is generated by the minors of size @xmath242 of @xmath67 which involve both row @xmath243 and column @xmath244 , while the ideal @xmath245 is generated by the minors of size @xmath246 of @xmath247 . for",
    "any minor @xmath248\\in i_{t_k}(l_k)$ ] which involves both row @xmath243 and column @xmath244 , consider the minor @xmath249\\in i_{t_k-1}(l'_k)$ ] .",
    "by @xcite , lemma  2.6 @xmath250\\cdot [ v_k - t_k+1,\\ldots , v_k-1,v_k;w_k - t_k+1,\\ldots , w_k-1,w_k]=\\ ] ] @xmath251\\cdot [ \\alpha_1,\\ldots,\\alpha_{t_k-1},v_k;\\beta_1,\\ldots,\\beta_{t_k-1},w_k]\\ ] ] modulo @xmath226 .",
    "therefore the ideals @xmath251\\cdot i_t(l)+i_u(j)\\ ] ] and @xmath252\\cdot i_{t'}(l')+i_u(j)\\ ] ] are equal , hence they are equal modulo @xmath226 . therefore isomorphism  ( [ isom ] ) holds , and @xmath53 and @xmath144 are g - bilinked on @xmath226 . repeating this procedure , one eventually reaches the ideal generated by the entries of the ladder @xmath172 defined in proposition  [ ht ] . clearly @xmath253 is a complete intersection .",
    "[ glicci ] every symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideal @xmath53 can be g - linked in @xmath254 steps to a complete intersection of linear forms of the same height .",
    "hence symmetric mixed ladder determinantal ideals are glicci .",
    "r. hartshorne , generalized divisors on gorenstein schemes , proceedings of conference on algebraic geometry and ring theory in honor of michael artin , part iii ( antwerp , 1992 ) , k - theory * 8 * ( 1994 ) , no .",
    "3 , 287339 .",
    "h. kleppe , d. laksov , the generic perfectness of determinantal schemes , algebraic geometry ( proc .",
    "summer meeting , univ .",
    "copenhagen , copenhagen , 1978 ) , 244252 , lecture notes in math . *",
    "732 * , springer , berlin ( 1979 ) .",
    "j. o. kleppe , j. c. migliore , r. m. mir - roig , u. nagel , and c. peterson , gorenstein liaison , complete intersection liaison invariants and unobstructedness , mem .",
    "soc . * 154 * ( 2001 ) , no ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we study the family of ideals generated by minors of mixed size contained in a ladder of a symmetric matrix from the point of view of liaison theory . </S>",
    "<S> we prove that they can be obtained from ideals of linear forms by ascending g - biliaison . </S>",
    "<S> in particular , they are glicci . </S>"
  ]
}
